name: Remy Russell
seeking: Currently seeking remote or hybrid roles in the Salt Lake City area.
summary: An optimistic and analytical product leader with three years of Product Management and seven years of Business Analysis experience evolving SaaS platforms for Health and Human Services Providers. Dedicated to understanding the users, opportunities, and technologies to ensure success of the business

professionalExperience.description: Product Lead on the Platform and Integrations R&D team for a configurable Case Management platform (Homeless Management, Medically Tailored Meals, Behavioral Health, etc.)
highlights: Helped drive growth in ARR by over 50% to ~$15M by expanding platform capabilities, leading to acquisition
Shipped a new RESTful API from 0 to 1 and onboarded over 10 customer organizations' developers
Evolved the platform and product lines based on business priorities and insights (e.g., SSO and 2-Step Verification, in-app file previews, scheduled CSV exports, API capabilities, etc.)
Partnered with Engineering, Sales, Leadership, and others to maintain the roadmap, define KPIs, and measure/communicate progress
Delivered and scrapped POCs/MVPs for new features or integrations (e.g., Health Information Exchanges, Claims Processing Systems, Twilio, Onfleet and WorkWave for last-mile delivery operations)

professionalExperience.description: Problem discovery, requirements gathering, and solutioning with new customers to guide new implementations on the case management platform.
highlights: Drove the successful implementation for two of Eccovia's top ten largest customers by ARR, including complex data migrations and integrations
Took ownership of all new integration contracts across new customers (over a dozen) and helped transition our technical strategy towards agnostic services to support multiple customers and partners

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst II, UT MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: System migration and gap analysis activities for implementation of a new Medicaid Management Information System for the Utah Department of Health
highlights: Collaborated with the State customer stakeholders and internal engineers to define and document comprehensive design details for the Provider Enrollment Subsystem to guide development and testing

professionalExperience.position: Business Analyst, MI MMIS Implementation Project
professionalExperience.description: Learned the end-to-end functionality of CNSIâ€™s 'Electronic Medicaid Incentive Payment Program' solution and partnered with Michigan DOH stakeholders on technical system design documentation
highlights: Analyzed program mandates published by the Center for Medicaid Services to design and implement compliant functionality

education.degree: BSE in Industrial & Operations Engineering, Certificate in Entrepreneurship 2015

coreSkills: Problem-solving and ownership of complex challenges
Articulating technical details or high-level strategy to varying stakeholders
Quick learner and adopter of new tools, technologies, processes
Proficiency in SQL, basic understanding of programming and SDLC concepts
Healthcare Interoperability experience (HL7 v2.x and FHIR)
Revenue Cycle Management interoperability experience for Medicaid reimbursement (X12 EDI Standards)
Daily user of AI tools professionally and personally
toolsAndFrameworks: Insight collection/consolidation (Hubspot, ProductBoard, Azure Dashboards, SQL, etc)
Mock-ups and low-fi prototyping (Figma, AI Tools)
Designing, Diagramming, & Brainstorming (Confluence Whiteboards, Lucidchart, AI tools)
No or low-code API Testing (Microsoft Power Automate, Zapier, Postman)
Dual-track Agile, Scrum (Jira for roadmapping, backlog refinement, Kanban workflows, sprint ceremonies, etc.)
fun: Outdoor activities (skiing, mountain biking, hiking, camping, overlanding)
Podcasts/audiobooks on anything related to tech, health, or science
